oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MACH-REFLECTION AS A DIFFRACTION PROBLEM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Berger, Udo
Kohlhase, Soren
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mach reflection
reflection
diffraction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: As under oblique wave approach water waves are reflected by a vertical wall, a wave branching effect (stem) develops normal to the reflecting wall. The waves progressing along the wall will steep up. The wave heights increase up to more than twice the incident wave height. The Â£jtudy has pointed out that this effect, which is usually called MACH-REFLECTION, is not to be taken as an analogy to gas dynamics, but should be interpreted as a diffraction problem.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 15 (1976): Proceedings of 15th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Honolulu, Hawaii, 1976.; 45
